intro: Saurauia longipetiolata var. longipetiolata, commonly known as the long-petioled saurauia, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Thailand, Malaysia, and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated petioles and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows as an epiphyte or on rocky substrates, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its foliage is evergreen, with glossy, lance-shaped leaves that contribute to its ornamental appeal.
